intro: Memora longilinea, commonly known as the slender memora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Memora longilinea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
